headline: Psalm of the Fence and the Light
description: A psalm of discernment and grace through opposition. The speaker reflects on the necessity of contrast — that light only shines because darkness exists to define it. Through confession and fear, he discovers boundary as revelation: holiness not as denial, but as divine geometry.

motifMap.meaning: Opposition as necessity — moral duality as divine balance.
Boundary as revelation — holiness defined by its limits.
Illumination through structure — grace visible only by contrast.
Spiritual discipline — the sacred distance that preserves clarity.
The necessary backdrop for divine understanding.

associatedMedia.description: Screenshot of the Substack post 'Psalm of the Fence and the Light' published on Wanderer’s Burn, October 2025.
